DataElement.preferredName: Negation Nodal Target Lesion Sum Longest Diameter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the aggregate longest diameters of non nodal (any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part) of target area of abnormal tissue change.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Nodal Target Lesion Sum Longest Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to aggregate longest diameters of non nodal (any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part) of target area of abnormal tissue change.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.:The goal intended to be attained.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.
An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sum; the final aggregate amount.:Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the sum of the longest diameters of a lesion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement
